org.rdkit.knime.nodes.onecomponentreaction2

Class AbstractRDKitReactionNodeModel<T extends AbstractRDKitReactionNodeDialog>

  • java.lang.Object
    • NodeModel
      • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        • org.rdkit.knime.nodes.onecomponentreaction2.AbstractRDKitReactionNodeModel<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RDKitObjectCleaner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RDKitOneComponentReactionNodeModel, RDKitTwoComponentReactionNodeModel

    public abstract class AbstractRDKitReactionNodeModel<T extends AbstractRDKitReactionNodeDialog>
extends AbstractRDKitNodeModel
    This abstract class provides base functionality for nodes that deal with reactions.
    Author:
    Greg Landrum, Manuel Schwarze

      • m_setRandomizedReactions

        protected java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> m_setRandomizedReactions
        If we randomize reactions this set contains representations of the reactions that shall be included or excluded (based on the flag m_bInclusionMode. A representation is either a Long object with a row index (for row-by-row reactions), or a string in the form n.m, where n and m are numeric row indexes of reactants (0 based).

      • isExpandReactantsMatrix

        protected abstract boolean isExpandReactantsMatrix()
        Returns true, if reactions shall be based on a matrix expansion (makes only sense for more than one reactant).
        Returns:
        True, if matrix expansion is desired.

      • initializeRandomization

        protected void initializeRandomization(BufferedDataTable[] inData)
        Initializes randomization of reactions. If randomization is switched on this method will initialize a random number generator with the random seed and it will pick reactions to be included honoring the maximum number of reactions setting of the user. It also determines, if randomization makes sense at all. As output it prepares intermediate result variables that are used in further processing. This method calls isExpandReactantsMatrix() to determine if total reactions would be based on the matrix of reactants (true) or a reactants processed row by row (false).
        Parameters:
        inData - Data tables with reactants.
        bExpandMatrix -

      • isReactionIncluded

        protected boolean isReactionIncluded(long... indexes)
        Determines, if the reaction of the reactants with the passed in row indexes shall be included in the calculation. This method is a read only method and therefore not synchronized for better performance.
        Parameters:
        indexes - Row indexes of reactants.
        Returns:
        True, if reaction should be included. False otherwise.

      • configure

        protected DataTableSpec[] configure(DataTableSpec[] inSpecs)
                             throws InvalidSettingsException
        Should be called before the own implementation starts its work. This clears all warnings from the warning consolidator and checks the error state of the native RDKit library.
        Overrides:
        configure in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException

      • createInputDataInfos

        protected InputDataInfo[] createInputDataInfos(int inPort,
                                               DataTableSpec inSpec)
                                        throws InvalidSettingsException
        This implementation generates an input data info object for the reaction column. This method needs to be implemented by a concrete node to generate InputDataInfo objects for each input column for all input tables. To find the proper column, the concrete node implementation must pass in the appropriate setting model of the column name into the constructor of the InputDataInfo class.
        Specified by:
        createInputDataInfos in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Parameters:
        inPort - The port number of the input table to create input data objects for.
        inSpec - The table specification of the input table. Can be null.
        Returns:
        An array of info objects for all columns used as input for the passed table. Should not return null. If no input columns are used from the passed table, it should return an empty array.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - Thrown, if the current settings or the spec of the input table will make it impossible to process the data.

      • createSafeGuardedReactionResource

        protected SafeGuardedResource<ChemicalReaction> createSafeGuardedReactionResource(BufferedDataTable[] inData,
                                                                                  InputDataInfo[][] arrInputDataInfo)
        Creates the chemical reaction to be applied as safe guarded resource to avoid corruption by multiple thread processing.
        Parameters:
        inData - All input data tables. The last table must be the reaction table by definition.
        arrInputDataInfo - Information about all columns of the input tables.
        Returns:
        Chemical reaction wrapped ina save guarded resource component.

      • createWarningContextOccurrencesMap

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> createWarningContextOccurrencesMap(BufferedDataTable[] inData,
                                                                                            InputDataInfo[][] arrInputDataInfo,
                                                                                            BufferedDataTable[] resultData)
        Creates a map with information about occurrences of certain contexts, which are registered in the warning consolidator. Such a context could for instance be the "row context", if the warning consolidator was configured with it and consolidates warnings that happen based on certain malformed data in input rows. In this case we would list the row number of the input table (inData[0]) for this row context. The passed in parameters are for convenience only, as most of the time the numbers depend on them to some degree. The default implementation delivers a map, which contains only one context - the ROW_CONTEXT of the consolidator - and as total number of occurrences the number of input rows in table 0. Override this method for differing behavior. This implementation considers the number of processed products.
        Overrides:
        createWarningContextOccurrencesMap in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Parameters:
        inData - All input tables of the node with their data.
        arrInputDataInfo - Information about all columns in the input tables.
        resultData - All result tables of the node that will be returned by the execute() method.
        Returns:
        Map with number of occurrences of different contexts, e.g. encountered rows during processing.
        See Also:
        AbstractRDKitNodeModel.getWarningConsolidator()

      • preProcessing

        protected void preProcessing(BufferedDataTable[] inData,
                             InputDataInfo[][] arrInputDataInfo,
                             ExecutionContext exec)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        This method gets called from the method AbstractRDKitNodeModel.execute(BufferedDataTable[], ExecutionContext), before the row-by-row processing starts. All necessary pre-calculations can be done here. Results of the method should be made available through member variables, which get picked up by the other methods like process(InputDataInfo[], DataRow) in the factory or AbstractRDKitNodeModel.postProcessing(BufferedDataTable[], InputDataInfo[][], BufferedDataTable[], ExecutionContext) in the model.
        Overrides:
        preProcessing in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Parameters:
        inData - The input tables of the node.
        arrInputDataInfo - Information about all columns of the input tables.
        exec - The execution context, which was derived as sub-execution context based on the percentage setting of #getPreProcessingPercentage(). Track the progress from 0..1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown, if pre-processing fails.

      • getPreProcessingPercentage

        protected double getPreProcessingPercentage()
        Description copied from class: AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Returns the percentage of pre-processing activities from the total execution.
        Overrides:
        getPreProcessingPercentage in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        Returns:
        Percentage of pre-processing. Default is 0.0d.

      • processReactionResults

        protected java.util.List<DataRow> processReactionResults(ChemicalReaction reaction,
                                                         ROMol_Vect reactants,
                                                         java.util.List<DataRow> listToAddTo,
                                                         long uniqueWaveId,
                                                         int... indicesReactants)
        Runs the passed in reaction with the specified reactants, if both parameters are not null. From the results it generates result rows containing the different products. The vector of vectors that is created internally as result of the reaction contains as outer vector reactions matching reactants multiple times, and the inner vector contains the products of each reaction.
        Parameters:
        reaction - Chemical reaction to run. Can be null.
        reactants - Reactants to be used as parameters for the reaction. Can be null.
        listToAddTo - A list to be used to add new rows. Can be null to create a new list.
        uniqueWaveId - Id to register RDKit objects for cleanup.
        indicesReactants - Indices of reactants passed in using the reactants mol vector. The length of this array must match the size of the reactants vector.
        Returns:
        List of new creates data rows with information about reaction products. Can be empty, but never null.

      • cleanupIntermediateResults

        protected void cleanupIntermediateResults()
        Description copied from class: AbstractRDKitNodeModel
        This method gets called at the very end of the node execution. It is called also after the user canceled the execution. It can be overridden to cleanup all intermediate results, e.g. arrays, which have been created to pass over values from pre-processing to processing to post-processing steps. Always check for null before calling cleanup functionality on resources. They may have never instancianted, if the user canceled before the resource was created. By default, this method is not doing anything. Exceptions thrown from this method will be caught and logged as a warning, but will not have any effect on the process flow.
        Overrides:
        cleanupIntermediateResults in class AbstractRDKitNodeModel

      • hasReactionInputTable

        public static boolean hasReactionInputTable(PortObjectSpec[] inSpecs,
                                            int iReactionTableIndex)
        Determines, if the condition is fulfilled that we have a reaction table with columns connected to the node according to the passed in specs.
        Parameters:
        inSpecs - Port specifications.
        iReactionTableIndex -
        Returns:
        True, if there is a reaction table present at the last index of the specs, and if it has columns.
